titlestmt.titleproper: Modern Babel : a study of confusion in the art world : typescript, Howard Devree

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:02:10 -0400.

did.unittitle: Modern Babel : a study of confusion in the art world : typescript, Howard Devree

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An unpublished typescript analyzing the phenomenon of modern art, especially in the U.S., as it has affected the artist, the public, and the art world in general. Devree dwells particularly on what he sees as a lack of understanding and cooperation between these groups.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel N70-24 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Howard Devree was an art critic for THE NEW YORK TIMES.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated 1970 by Mrs. Howard Devree, widow of Howard Devree.

controlaccess.occupation: Art critics -- New York (State) -- New York
